basics.name: Carol Wong
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii at Manoa. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

volunteer.summary: Led my high school's girls team in the Open Division CyberPatriot’s National Youth Cyber Defense Competition
highlights: Worked with a team of 8 to modify and maintain a system's cyber defense
Assessed a virtual operating system's vulnerabilities

volunteer.summary: A volunteering club dedicated to community service projects
highlights: Volunteered at Kuakini Medical Center, Moanalua Elementary, and Moanalua High School
Designed and advised on the printing of the club t-shirt

awards.title: Provost Achievement Scholarship
awards.summary: $40,000 scholarship awarded to incoming freshman students who are residents of Hawai‘i with a minimum overall GPA of 3.8 (4.0 scale). Evidence of superior academic achievement or creative endeavor and record of academic, co-curricular, and community service activities.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean’s List distinction if they: (1) earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade, and (2) do not receive grades of W, I, F, or NC for that semester.

awards.title: Pele Awards - Silver Specialty Advertising
awards.summary: Each year, the Pele Awards recognizes excellence in advertising & design in Hawaii. The Pele Awards is one of fifteen National District Competitions for the American Advertising Awards.

awards.title: T-Shirt Design - First Place
awards.summary: The Hawaii High School Graphics Exhibition recognizes graphic design talent within high schools in Hawaii.
